ratings.question_text: The readings/cases/textbooks used in this course were __________ .
Out-of-class assignments for this course were ___________ to my learning.
The workload for this course in comparison to other courses was ___________.
The pace of this class was ____________ for optimal learning.
Field trips were well designed and ran smoothly.
I learned a lot from field trips.
How clearly does the instructor provide explanations of conceptual material?
How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
comments: Best class at FES this semester! Very useful and practical information presented during lectures. The group presentation was fun and enjoyable and I learned a lot about CSR.

12 It was very valuable! I think that it could be made more clear how applicable this course is across areas of interest to students, not just ecology/life sciences. The connection to industrial ecology was made very well.

I absolutely loved this course. It was a fun way to learn a bit more about the environment from the business side, and it taught me about opportunities for employment that I hadn't considered before. Kris was funny, helpful, and engaging. Totally approachable. This class was such a nice break in my week, and it was definitely my favorite of the semester, because of its light, casual feel.
I would have liked more direct discussion and reflection related to the readings.

narratives.question_text: What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: Listening to Kris's stories about working in industry and for the corporate sector. The pasta also helped!
The way that every part of the course was tied together - lectures, concepts we dealt with int he field/lab and readings and problem sets.
I loved hearing about Kris's and the other speakers personal experiences!
Kris established a classroom environment where everyone felt comfortable contributing their thoughts. I also enjoyed the guest speakers, particularly Ann Klee and Shaun.
Hear about real world experiences from wonderful leaders

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: Nothing. I liked the more relaxed atmosphere. It was a good break from regular courses, but I also learned a lot.
A more understandable designation between instructors' parts of the course.
Explain more of the pre planed materials/topics

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
comments: very complementary.

narratives.question_text: Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
comments: This course is a requirement for the Specialization in Land Management, Use and Policy, yet it focuses primarily on the role of environmental managers in "industry" and does not address land-related issues explicitly.
Very useful information for preparing students for the real world.
As someone who is looking to transition to the private sector, this course provides a useful introduction to how organizations operate and structure their corporate sustainability/EHS functions.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: This course is a requirement for the Specialization in Land Management, Use and Policy.
Wanted to gain more professional skills and more job related experience.
To get exposure to ecology, which I have not gotten in my academic background.
I wanted to learn more about what type of jobs are available in the business/private sector.
For management and leadership skills in the environmental field
interest in subject

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
comments: Yes.
Yes. This was my favorite class!
Yes, absolutely. Learned a lot from a fabulous professor.
I did not learn anything that I had not experienced already in the workplace

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: Fun way to learn about a topic as well as get to know a smaller group of people.
I enjoyed the group projects/discussions and presentations in class. It was a good way to break up the lectures.

It was really great working with a group on our final presentation for this course. We learned a lot about the company we researched, and, I think more importantly, we learned how to look for information about private companies and how to review that information.

narratives.question_text: For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: Everyone should take this course and the information is applicable for any professional in almost any field.
Take it!
Just take it! It's an easy and fun credit, and Kris is awesome.

This course is probably best for those who have never had work experience in a corporate environment or a place run in a very corporate-like manner. I realized that this course was not for me since I have had experience in this area before. However, I did not realize my experience was valuable and valid until I took this course - for this reason, I think this course was beneficial in this way.
